VLIB_initMeanWithLumaS16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_initMeanWithLumaS16 (int16_t *restrict runningMean, const uint8_t *restrict lumaFrame, const uint32_t pixelCount)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_initMeanWithLumaS16 ( int16_t *restrict  runningMean,
const uint8_t *restrict  lumaFrame,
const uint32_t  pixelCount 
)

Description:
The function VLIB_initMeanWithLumaS16() is used to initialize a running mean buffer with luma values. In this process, all UQ8.0 luma values are converted into SQ8.7 representation.
Parameters:
[out] runningMean Running 16-bit mean (SQ8.7)
[in] lumaFrame Luma frame used to initialize runningMean buffer (UQ8.0)
[in] pixelCount Number of pixels to process (UQ32.0)
Assumptions:
  • I/O buffers are assumed to be double-word aligned and not aliased.
  • The pixelCount must be a multiple of 8.
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is interrupt-tolerant but not interruptible
  • This code is compatible with C6XXX fixed-point processors
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
